data.title: Goran Todić's Personality Unveiled: MBTI, Enneagram and More
data.meta_description: What 16 personality type is Goran Todić from Bosnia and Herzegovina? Find out Goran Todić's 16 type, Enneagram, and Zodiac sign in the Soulverse, the comprehensive personality database.
data.text:
Goran Todić Bio

Goran Todić is a notable Bosnian actor, director, and producer who has made significant contributions to the entertainment industry in Bosnia and Herzegovina. Born on September 23, 1968, in Mostar, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Goran Todić initially pursued a career in law before eventually realizing his true passion for acting. He graduated from the Academy of Performing Arts in Sarajevo in 1995 and has since become one of the most respected actors in the region. As an actor, Todić has appeared in numerous theatre productions, feature films, and television series. Some of his most notable performances include his roles in the plays "The Garden of Delights" and "Mother Courage and Her Children," and in films such as "No Man's Land," "Days and Hours," and "Na putu." He has received critical acclaim for many of his performances and has been nominated for multiple awards for his work. In addition to acting, Todić has also directed and produced several theatre productions, including "Katherine Makmak" and "Ferenhajt." He has also directed and produced several short films, including "The Box" and "Life Beneath." Goran Todić's contributions to the entertainment industry in Bosnia and Herzegovina have been significant. He has helped to promote and develop the country's cultural scene, and his work has been instrumental in bringing attention to the region's talent and creativity. Todić continues to be a force in the entertainment industry and is considered one of the most talented and respected actors, directors, and producers in Bosnia and Herzegovina.

Which Enneagram Type is Goran Todić?

Goran Todić is an Enneagram Four personality type with a Three wing or 4w3. 4w3s have competitive and image-conscious energy that wants to be unique and a total stand out. However, their sensitivity from the third wing makes them more aware of what others think than those who have a fourth type temperament or fifth wing influence on social acceptability. Healing by eliminating their own feelings does not come easily for them as deep down they also yearn for self-expression to be heard and understood.
